com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.policies

Interface Apply

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ApplyTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ApplyStub

    public interface Apply
extends Service, ApplyTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Apply interface provides methods to configure the policies that will impact how the software and configuration specification documents are applied to an ESXi cluster.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Apply.GetInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Apply#get vAPI operation.
      static interface  Apply.SetInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Apply#set vAPI operation.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.policies.ApplyTypes

        ApplyTypes.ConfiguredPolicySpec, ApplyTypes.FailureAction, ApplyTypes.ParallelRemediationAction

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.vmware.esx.settings.clusters.policies.ApplyTypes

        _VAPI_SERVICE_ID

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Apply.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String cluster)
      Returns the configured policy that has been set for the cluster.
      Apply.SetInvocation set(java.lang.String cluster, ApplyTypes.ConfiguredPolicySpec spec)
      This API will set the configured policy specification for the cluster.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        Apply.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String cluster)
        Returns the configured policy that has been set for the cluster.

        Invocation Result:
        The configured policies that impact the apply method

        Operation Errors:
        Error - If there is an unknown internal error. The accompanying error message will give more details about the failure.
        NotFound - If there is no cluster associated with cluster in the system.
        ServiceUnavailable - If the service is not available.
        Unauthenticated - if the caller is not authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:

        • Method execution requires VcIntegrity.lifecycleSettings.Read.
        • The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires VcIntegrity.lifecycleSettings.Read.

        Parameters:
        cluster - The cluster identifier. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        Returns:
        instance of Apply.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • set

        Apply.SetInvocation set(java.lang.String cluster,
                        ApplyTypes.ConfiguredPolicySpec spec)
        This API will set the configured policy specification for the cluster.

        Operation Errors:
        Error - If there is an unknown internal error. The accompanying error message will give more details about the failure.
        NotFound - If there is no cluster associated with cluster in the system.
        InvalidArgument - If invalid value is provided.
        ServiceUnavailable - If the service is not available.
        Unauthenticated - If the caller is not authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:

        • Method execution requires VcIntegrity.lifecycleSettings.Write.
        • The resource ClusterComputeResource referenced by the parameter cluster requires VcIntegrity.lifecycleSettings.Write.

        Parameters:
        cluster - The cluster identifier. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        spec - The policy that needs to be configured.
        Returns:
        instance of Apply.SetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described set operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
